resources.string: • CropCure -app that empowers farmers to effortlessly identify potato plant diseases with just a simple photo taken from their smartphone.
• Our cutting-edge deep learning algorithm processes the data to provide accurate disease detection results, saving farmers valuable time and resources.

• CropCure also includes an array of additional features to help farmers make the most of their crops, such as up-to-date weather forecasts, an easy-to-use fertilizer calculator, crop advisories, cultivation tips and much more.
• The app support multilanguage and provide chatAI.
Identify potato diseases instantly with machine learning for healthier crops and better yields
Stay prepared with accurate weather forecasts for the next three days, ensuring plans go smoothly
Engage in natural conversations with our intelligent AI Chatbot, ready to assist and provide valuable insights.
Take a Picture to know the potato leaf disease.
Dark spots on leaves with circle around them and yellow rings around the spots.
White fungus cover the underside of leaves
Fungal diseases thrive in wet conditions, so it is important to keep the leaves dry.
• Reduce the humidity around the plant by watering."
"• Improve air flow around the plant by leaving sufficient space between each plant."
• Avoid planting potatoes in the same field consecutively.
• Ensure adequate spacing between potato plants.
• Planting potato varieties that exhibit resistance to late blight.
• Late blight tends to occur under cool and moist conditions
• For planting,remove potato seeds from cold storage.
• Select healthy,medium or small sized tubers.
• The ideal tuber size for planting is about 2.5cm in diameter.
• Smaller size tubers should be rejected for planting as they may carry diseases.
• Treat tubers with fungicides before letting them sprout.
• Cut large tubers for planting as the last step.
• Potato plants have a shallow and sparse root system, so regular and uniform irrigation is essential.
• The first irrigation should be light and done 5-7 days after planting.
• Subsequent irrgations should be done an interval of 7-15 days depending upon climatic conditions and soil type.
• Withhold irrigation 10-15 days prior to digging up the potatoes for harvest.
• For planting,remove potato seeds from cold storage.
• Select healthy,medium or small sized tubers.
• The ideal tuber size for planting is about 2.5cm in diameter.
• Smaller size tubers should be rejected for planting as they may carry diseases.
• Treat tubers with fungicides before letting them sprout.
• Cut large tubers for planting as the last step.
• Late blight in potatoes is primarily caused by a pathogenic oomycete (water mold) called Phytophthora infestans.
Fungal diseases thrive in wet conditions, so it is important to keep the leaves dry.
